Class ChatBotServer.SockServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ChatBotServer.SockServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    ChatBotServer

    private class ChatBotServer.SockServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This is the private inner class which contains the code for setting up a client thread. It implements runnable, and is ran using the executor service. Each instance is one client's connection to the server. It has the input and output streams for the client to connect to the server. It has a main run method, which is run while the thread is up. It gets the ObjectStreams for both the input and the output streams, and then does the processing. Once done processing, it closes all of the streams and sockets correctly.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean active
      This boolean is turned true when the thread is running, and false when it isn't
      private java.net.Socket connection
      This socket is for the server to output and input streams
      private boolean firstMessage
      This boolean is only true for the very first message recieved from the client
      private java.io.ObjectInputStream input
      This stream takes in any input from the client for the server
      private java.io.ObjectOutputStream output
      This stream outputs any information that the client might need
      private int userNumber
      This int is the unique number of the current client's identifier

    • Constructor Detail

      • SockServer

        public SockServer(int userNumber)
        This is the constructor which sets up the thread. It only takes in on int, which is the unique number identifying which thread this client is.
        Parameters:
        userNumber - int of the current client's identifier

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is what is run while the thread is alive for the client. It first get's the input and output streams to the server. It then performs all of the processing for the client server interactions. Once done, the connection is carefully and cleanly closed.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • connect

        private void connect()
              throws java.io.IOException
        This method allows the server to accept connections from clients. It is ran while the server is up.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception if there is a problem connecting to the client

      • getSocketIOAddress

        private void getSocketIOAddress()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method helps the server get IO streams to a client. It creates both an input and an output stream between the client.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception if there is a problem establishing the streams

      • endConnection

        private void endConnection()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method helps successfully and safely terminate the server once it must be terminated. It closes all of the streams and also the socket.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception if there is a problem shutting down the server

      • processing

        private void processing()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method contains the framework for the main exchange between the client and the server. It takes in the user input from the client and then prints it to all other clients on the same channel and also the server. The very first message received from the client is which channel they chose to join, either one or two. This is processed, and then the client joins their channel. This is shown to all the other current clients on the channel, and then all of the previous messages before the current client joined are sent to the current client. Once connected, whenever the client, any of the other clients on the channel, or the server sends a message it is output to the client. This is done until the client disconnects. Once the client disconnects, it safely exits the server and notifies other clients on the channel and also the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception if there is any problem processing the client requests.

      • sendMessageToAllClients

        private void sendMessageToAllClients(java.lang.String message)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used when both the server and all of the clients receive the same message. It takes in the message and outputs it to the server JTextArea and also sends it through all of the output streams. It sends it to every client that is connected to the server. It only sends it to the active clients. It also adds whatever is sent to the string builders which contain records of all the files sent on both channel one and two.
        Parameters:
        message - String of the message to be displayed by both the server and the clients
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception if there is a problem displaying the message to either the client or the server

      • sendMessageToAllClients

        private void sendMessageToAllClients(java.lang.String message,
                                     int channelNumber)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used when both the server and all of the clients on one channel receive the same message. It takes in the message and outputs it to the server JTextArea and also sends it through all of the output streams on one channel. It sends it to every client that is connected to the client. It only sends it to the active clients. It also adds whatever is sent to the string builders which contain records of all the files sent on either channel one or two.
        Parameters:
        message - String of the message to be displayed by both the server and the clients
        channelNumber - int of the channel the message should be sent to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception if there is a problem displaying the message to either the client or the server

      • sendMessageToAllClients

        private void sendMessageToAllClients(java.lang.String message,
                                     int channelNumber,
                                     java.lang.String message2)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method is the exact same as the two parameter version of this method, it just contains an extra string which contains the original message without the user who sent it. This is used to be sent to the bot which then provides a response if a user enters a certain message in.
        Parameters:
        message - String of the message to be displayed by both the server and the clients
        channelNumber - int of the channel the message should be sent to
        message2 - String of the message without the current user
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception if there is a problem displaying the message to either the client or the server
